document_title: Pulmonary fibrosis: Causes, symptoms, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
The progression of the disease and the severity of pulmonary fibrosis vary in each patient. Some patients progress very quickly with severe symptoms, while others only have mild symptoms that gradually develop. Strong complications after several months or a year. Prof. Dr. Ngo Quy Chau recommends that patients need to pay special attention when there are signs such as:
Difficulty breathing, especially during or after physical activity or dry cough;; Dry cough, prolonged cough, wheezing cough, possibly coughing up blood;; Chest pain;; Pain in muscles and joints;; Frequently falling into a state of fatigue, losing weight... for unknown reasons.
